https://www.thetimes.com/uk/politics/art.title: Tory green campaigner Ben Goldsmith apologises for supporting oil protests
https://www.thetimes.com/uk/politics/art.text:
Conservative MPs have called on Ben Goldsmith to be sacked from his role at the environment department after he backed Extinction Rebellion.
Goldsmith, 41, a financier and green campaigner who is chairman of the Conservative Environment Network (CEN), said that fuel protests were justified as a way to “wake people up” to the climate emergency.
Just Stop Oil, an offshoot of Extinction Rebellion, began blockading oil terminals on April 1. The group said it had “no choice but to enter into civil resistance until the government announces an end to new oil and gas projects in the UK”.

https://www.thetimes.com/uk/environment/.title: Just Stop Oil protester: I don’t care if I’m the most hated man in Britain — I’ll ruin my life to give others a future
https://www.thetimes.com/uk/environment/.text:
After 17 arrests and a prison spell to his name over the past year for his part in a wave of climate protests, Louis McKechnie could question whether his actions are worthwhile.
Yet rather than stepping back, the Just Stop Oil activist has announced a willingness to become “the most hated man in the UK” if it helps to achieve the group’s goals.
The 21-year-old is one of the most prominent figures in the group that has been targeting oil plants and tankers since the beginning of the month, causing traffic disruption and fuel shortages in some areas.

https://www.thetimes.com/uk/crime/articl.title: Just Stop Oil activist glues hand to LBC microphone in protest at radio silence
https://www.thetimes.com/uk/crime/articl.text:
A climate activist glued his hand to a microphone during a radio interview in London about protests at oil terminals.
Nathan McGovern, 22, told the LBC presenter Tom Swarbrick that he was taking the action because the station was not using its “massive platform” to tell its listeners about the climate crisis. His hand was freed before police arrived.
Officers said that more than 200 people were arrested as protests by Just Stop Oil entered a third day. Warwickshire police made 54 arrests for offences including criminal damage, obstructing the highway and public order in relation to a protest at Kingsbury Oil Terminal.
In Essex officers have arrested a total of 155 people following protests in the Thurrock district.

https://www.thetimes.com/uk/article/exti.title: Extinction Rebellion climate activists seal off Lloyd’s of London
https://www.thetimes.com/uk/article/exti.text:
Fuel protesters forced Lloyd’s of London to shut its headquarters yesterday after blocking the entrances and scaling the outside of the building to unfurl banners.
More than 60 members of Extinction Rebellion arrived at the insurance marketplace in the City and used glue, chains and bike locks to obstruct all 25 entrances to the grade I listed building.
Staff were asked to work at home for the day after activists, some dressed as rats wearing suits and others as cleaners, arrived at the office at 7am.
The group demanded that Lloyd’s stop insuring coal, oil and gas projects and unfurled banners reading “End Fossil Fuels Now” and “Insure Climate Justice”.

https://www.thetimes.com/uk/crime/articl.title: Just Stop Oil protesters glue themselves to pumps at M25 petrol stations
https://www.thetimes.com/uk/crime/articl.text:
Climate activists have glued themselves to petrol pumps in an act of sabotage after blocking forecourts at two motorway service stations.
Just Stop Oil said that 35 supporters were involved. The protesters smashed display glass and sprayed paint after stopping motorists from entering forecourts at Cobham Services and Clacket Lane Services in Surrey at 7am on Thursday.
At both locations Just Stop Oil supporters blocked the entrances to the petrol pump area by sitting in the road with banners.
